items.sentence: If a thing is worth doing, it\'s worth doing well.
If it snows a lot tomorrow, let\'s make a snowman.
Tom\'s workstation is usually tidier than Mary\'s.
What\'s the best compliment you\'ve ever received?
I don\'t quite understand what you\'re getting at.
It\'s already been ten years since we got married.
It\'s been five years since my father passed away.
It\'s been three months since Tom moved to Boston.
Tom put the pie on the kitchen windowsill to cool.
Tax credits are available to help offset the cost.
That is the same umbrella that I found on the bus.
I\'m going to have you read the letter to me, Tom.
I believe it\'s my duty to protect these children.
You need to stop ignoring email messages from Tom.
You obviously love Tom and he obviously loves you.
You of all people should understand how Tom feels.
Tom wears long sleeves when working in the garden.
I suspect Tom did that just to get some attention.
I suspect that Tom expects me to help him do that.
I suspect that Tom has already left for Australia.
